intro: Tragia cocculifolia, commonly known as the "arrowleaf bugseed," is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Tragia cocculifolia is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
